commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Thanks for coming to help, everyone.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Oh, please. The info session is for the volunteers who signed up to support us, right? Put us to work helping too!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Exactly. Now's the time for us to pool our resources and work together.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Yeah, we want to make our dreams come true together. It won't be worth it unless we all do it as a group.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You're right. This wasn't just Nijigasaki's problem to deal with alone. Sorry about that.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Oh, come on. There's nothing to apologize for.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: I agree. We're just as excited as you to meet everyone who agreed to volunteer.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: All right, what should we discuss first?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: There's a lot to dive into, but let's start with the info packets. I've already written up the text.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: So we need to staple 1,000 copies of info packets.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Making up packets can actually be pretty intensive work.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I thought of a good idea! Let's have a competition to see who can put together the most packets! If we're all racing to be first, we'll be done in a flash!

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: A competition? Hmm... Yeah, I would hate to lose.

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: I'm not gonna lose either!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Settle down, all of you. We need to consider how we can make them the most efficiently.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: You may have a point, but I definitely feel the most excited about a competition. You're all going down!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Shouldn't we make this a bit more interesting? Let's add a prize or a punishment for losing!

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: If the prize was something from the Nijigasaki cafeteria, I'd work really hard. That pork cutlet rice bowl looks so good.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: I'd want the dessert plate, zura!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I could never allow myself to lose if we were fighting over Nijigasaki's famous rice bowls!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: That's the spirit, guys! I'm really feeling your hunger! To get everyone's motivation and efficiency up, I think we have to add a prize to our competition!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I think it's wonderful that everyone's so excited, but...at least let us do the photocopying properly!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I agree. Once the copies are made, let's divide them up evenly and then race to see who can finish their pile first. I guess I've gotten into the competitive spirit too!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Well, if you're all doing it, I'm not losing out!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: We're not going to punish the losers, right?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Punish... Oh, what a lovely ring that has to it. Do not speak to me of competitions unless there is punishment. Yes, and by punishment I mean--

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Yoshiko, what do you want to eat from the cafeteria?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: What? Me? Oh... The thick toast in the B meal combo looks good... And hey, call me Yohane, not Yoshiko!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: No need to worry, Kotori. I'm pretty sure all this talk of prizes has made everyone forget all about punishments.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Do you really think so?

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: I was feeling nervous about the idea of a punishment too. If there isn't one, I can do my Rubesty at my own pace!

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Kotori, Ruby, don't give up before it's even started! Please show us those same strong emotions you have during your regular school idol activities!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Uwahhh?!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Don't worry. Umi isn't saying that you have to win. But it's good to be ambitious, right?

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Right! Setsuna, I'm so glad you understand!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Of course I do, Umi! I think it's very important to be ambitious!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Ooh, I didn't expect these two to be so similar.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Okay, guys! Once we're done printing out copies, let the packet making competition begin! You're all on!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh no, I'm late! I'd better hurry!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh, Shioriko?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Hello. How are the preparations coming for the volunteer info session?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Right on track. We're finishing everything up today. Are you at school to do student council work? That's rough, working on a Saturday.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What? Oh, um, of course I'm here on student council business. Er, I hope tomorrow's info session...goes well.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Thanks, I'm sure it will. We're all working hard to make that happen.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Even so, it may not... No, I won't rain on your parade. I'll be there tomorrow as student council president.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: For sure! Good luck with your work too, Shioriko.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Yes, thank you.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Listen! We finished placing the info packets on all the seats. Phew... A thousand packets sure is a lot. But I think I placed the most.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Kasumi, you were too slow during the last part. I'm pretty sure I placed the most packets on seats. Rina-chan Board says, "Serious!"

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: What? No way!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Laugh* Good job, Kasumi and Rina. I've put some drinks out over there, so go take a break.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Hey, I borrowed a projector for the slide presentation! Should I SLIDE it on over here?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Chuckle* That's perfect! And great pun, too!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: I'm on fire today!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Everyone's gonna take off their shoes before entering the school auditorium and be in just their socks, right? Shouldn't we provide slippers?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh, you're right. We'll have to borrow some from the teachers' lounge.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: In that case, let me go ask! I'll bring them back.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Chika, you've got so much energy. I'm already exhausted from all that competing over stapling and placing packets.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Yeah, I'm still all ready to go!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Please come look at our registration table.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Okay, I'll be right there. Ayumu, could you come with me?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Sure!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Hey...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: It's finally tomorrow, huh. I ran into Shioriko on my way to the clubroom. She said she hopes everything goes well.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: She did? Aww, that's so nice. She's pretty strict, but she really does care about us.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (After tomorrow's info session, it's just a straight shot all the way to the School Idol Festival... Everyone's getting fired up about it. I've gotta get psyched up too!)
